body.p: Hunt groups are used to route incoming calls to a group of designated extensions or application ports. A hunt group consists of a hunt group extension number (pilot number) and a group of member extension numbers or ports. Calls to the hunt group extension ring the first idle member in the group. Enter the hunt group extension numbers and starting port extensions for the hunt groups or use the default settings provided.

note.p: You also have the option of accepting the default values displayed.

strow.stentry: Set the length from (3 to 7 digits) of the system extension numbers.
Select the number of purchased embedded voice mail licenses.
Enter the number of voice mail ports required. See for the number of voice mail ports that can be accommodated for users of different sizes.
Enter the number of RAD (Recorded Announcement Device) ports to reserve for future. See for the number of RAD ports that can be reserved for users of different sizes.
Extension that users dial to reach the voice mail system.
First extension in the extension group. It is used by the voice mail system to connect a user to the voice mail system.
Voice Mail Record A Call Hunt Group
Extension that users dial to reach the voice mail record-a-call system.
MiCollab Audio, Web and Video Conferencing (AWV) Hunt Group

Extension that users dial to reach the AWV system.
This field is visible only if MiCollab is part of the deployment.
MiCollab Audio, Web and Video Conferencing (AWV) Starting Port

First extension in the group of extensions that is used to connect an outside caller or internal user to the AWV system.
This field is visible only if MiCollab is part of the deployment.
